status.description:
Indicates whether the IPSec connection is currently operational.
Possible values include: ACTIVE, DOWN, BUILD, ERROR,
PENDING_CREATE, PENDING_UPDATE, or PENDING_DELETE.

peer_cidrs.description:
Unique list of valid peer private CIDRs in the form < net_address >
/ < prefix > .

initiator.description:
Indicates whether this VPN can only respond to connections or both
respond to and initiate connections. A valid value is ``response-
only`` or ``bi-directional`` . Default is ``bi-directional`` .

description.description: Human-readable description for the IPSec connection.

admin_state_up.description:
The administrative state of the IPSec connection, which is up (
``true`` ) or down ( ``false`` ). If down, the connection does not
forward packets.

tenant_id.description:
Owner of the IPSec connection. Only administrative users can
specify a tenant ID other than their own.

interval.description:
The DPD interval, in seconds. A valid value is a positive integer.
Default is 30.

auth_mode.description:
The authentication mode. A valid value is ``psk`` , which is the
default.

mtu.description:
The maximum transmission unit (MTU) to address fragmentation. The
minimum value for IPv4 is 68. The minimum value for IPv6 is 1280.

dpd.description: A dictionary with Dead Peer Detection protocol controls.

route_mode.description: The route mode. A valid value is ``static`` , which is the default.

action.description:
The DPD action. A valid value is ``clear`` , ``hold`` , ``restart``
, ``disabled`` , or ``restart-by-peer`` . Default value is ``hold``
.

peer_address.description: Peer gateway public IPv4/IPv6 address or FQDN.

peer_id.description:
Peer router identity for authentication. Can be IPv4/IPv6 address,
e-mail address, key id, or FQDN. Typically is same as
``peer_address`` .

timeout.description:
The DPD timeout, in seconds. A valid value is a positive integer
that is greater than the DPD ``interval`` value. Default is 120.

id.description: The unique ID for the IPSec connection.

name.description:
Human-readable name for the IPSec connection. Does not have to be
unique.
